Html.content:
If you add a new resource type to OpenCms, using theÂ "Add resource type" wizard in the "Module Management" in the administration view, the wizard does already all the configuration for the type in the opencms-modules.xml and adds the message keys just discussed to a suitable message bundle. This bundle is located under the i18n/ subfolder of the module folder and named {module name}.workplace. The keys are entered for the current workplace locale. So you just need to add keys for the other locales.Note that via the content editor you can only edit the locales configure (for website contents) which are not necessarily identical to the workplace locales. Localization as done by the wizard is the preferred way for localizing resource types.

Note that, to make the keys work, their use must be configured correctly in the opencms-modules.xml. This is automatically done by the wizard as long as you do not leave the dialog fields empty where title etc. must be added.
